column2: mrsnabors, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Was given to my 6 year old son for allergies. It worked with just one dose.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a cough that would not go away. This medicine took away my cough almost instantly.  I would have given it five stars but it left my throat and back of my tounge numb.

column2: 0-2 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Prescribed to my son from 11-16 months to help relieve symptoms of croup.  Only give 1/4 tsp at night to help decongest and ease cough so he can rest.  Best treatment so far to help with symptoms.

I have never been Rx this before but it works. It has a bad taste but you have to get paste that. However, my dr. prescribed it as an alternative to the codeine for night time because this was the strongest on the market that wasn't a narcotic...he mainly did this so I could function during the day at work. First morning I took it I nearly fell asleep at the wheel. When I got to work I was allowed to nap for about 20 minutes. Thank God I have an understanding boss...anyway, it made me very sleepy but it worked great at clearing my nose and ears and stopping my throat from hurting as much.

column2: dandy134, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: A 5 ounce bottle of this medicine cost 43.00 and it wasn't worth it at all.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This is by far the worst decongestant/cough suppresant my 2 year old has ever been prescribed after an hour of giving him the 2.5ml he became extremly irritable, non-stop crying hitting his head and ears he was inconsolable for 5 hours and yet the cough/congested continued as a parent I would never recommend this med, i think it should be taken off the market!!

column2: lildarling, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Taste isn't the best but it dang sure did work on my cough and itchy throat. I could breathe a lot better after taking it and I wasn't coughing at all.

column2: geegee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this to take for my cough and it works great.  I was looking on here to see what it was because I had never heard of it. Very pleased! Stopped my cough, runny nose, and sore throat. It's not the best tasting stuff but it works.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This med was prescribed by the Pediatrician for my 3 y/o and 19 m/o for a viral/cold with cough & fevor.  The 3 y/o tolerated it well; However, the 19 month old became very irritable, crying, hitting her head, temper tantrums, inconsolable, sweating profusely.  No rash or other normal things you look for in a reaction, but it had to be this med.  It was scarey.

column2: vickicatherine, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication helped me with nasal congestion but I am still coughing alot.

column2: sheff, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This medication was prescribed for my 2-year old and has made her extremely irritable, she isn't sleeping, and she seems confused. She is also not wanting to urinate.  She did better with infant's Tylenol.

column2: majyrox, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: So far it hasn't done anything, but I just started using today. Der. =]

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This was prescribed for my 1year old, 2mL every 6 hours.  Immediately cleared her nose and stopped her cough, but made her so irritable and excitable she couldn't stand herself.  Uncontrollable crying, temper tantrums, and refusal to be held, put down, etc.  Wondering if the 2mL prescribed by her pediatrician was an overdose (stated by manufacturer to take 2.5mL for 6 to 12 year old) .  VERY concerned about this medication being prescribed by pediatrician for a 1 year old. Note:  previous experience with Benadryl produced similar side effects in our child.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dr. prescribed due to inflammation in chest and chronic sinusitis. Only one teaspoonful at a time proves strength of product. I only wish I could find a generic equivalent, as I have a very limited income.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Drug given to my 13 year daughter. No fever, however ears felt full. No abt given. Md felt viral in nature. After 2 doses ears feeling much better. Taken with her other sinus meds with no interaction.

column2: 55-64 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It did help my cough and congestion/stuffy nose, but caused my restless legs to worsen which kept me awake, so didn't get any more rest than I would have with the cough and stuffy nose to start with.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: This medication has listed that it soes not have a sedating side effect, which in fact it is very much sedating.
